definitions.definition: give something to (someone) formally or ceremonially.
examples: a top executive will present an award to employees who built the F-150
synonyms: accord "the president presented a check to the winner"

examples: my students presented me with some flowers

definitions.definition: show or offer (something) for others to scrutinize or consider.
examples: he stopped and presented his passport

synonyms: acquaint someone with "may I present my wife?"

definitions.definition: proffer (compliments or good wishes) in a formal manner.
examples: may I present the greetings of my master?
synonyms: express "I called to present my warmest compliments"

definitions.definition: formally deliver (a check or bill) for acceptance or payment.
examples: a check presented by Mr. Jackson was returned by the bank

definitions.definition: bring (a complaint, petition, or evidence) formally to the notice of a court.
(of a company or producer) put (a show or exhibition) before the public.
examples: demonstrate, show, put on show/display, exhibit, display, launch, unveil More"they presented their new product last month"stage, put on, produce, perform "presenting good quality opera"Morethey presented their new product last monthstage, put on, produce, perform presenting good quality opera

definitions.definition: bring about or be the cause of (a problem or difficulty).
examples: this should not present much difficulty

definitions.definition: exhibit (a particular state or appearance) to others.
examples: the EC presented a united front over the crisis

definitions.definition: represent (someone) to others in a particular way, typically one that is false or exaggerated.
examples: he presented himself as a hardworking man
synonyms: depict "the authorities present him as a common criminal"

definitions.definition: come forward into the presence of another or others, especially for a formal occasion; appear.
examples: he failed to present himself in court

definitions.definition: (of an opportunity or idea) occur and be available for use or exploitation.
examples: when a favorable opportunity presented itself, he would submit his proposition

definitions.definition: (of a patient) come forward for or undergo initial medical examination for a particular condition or symptom.
examples: the patient presented with mild clinical encephalopathy

definitions.definition: (of a part of a fetus) be directed toward the cervix during labor.
hold out or aim (a firearm) at something so as to be ready to fire.
examples: they were to present their rifles, take aim, and fire
